tweet: Today and every day we #StandWithSaudiFeminists, and we demand that Saudi officials #FreeLoujain. Read more about Loujain’s story here: https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jul/14/loujain-al-hathloul-family-imprisoned-saudi-activist …

With my support, the House recently passed H.Res. 129 to condemn the continued detention of these women’s rights advocates and reaffirm U.S. commitment to promoting human rights, particularly the empowerment of women and girls.

For three months, her Saudi captors tortured her and did not let her contact her family. Her story, along with those of many other Saudi female activists, are clear signs of the cruel human rights violations occurring in Saudi Arabia.

Saudi Arabian women’s rights activist Loujain al-Hathloul turns 30 today - behind bars in a Saudi prison. Loujain has been imprisoned for nearly 450 days, 10 months of which she was held without charges or a trial.

54 yrs ago today, Pres. Johnson signed Medicare & Medicaid into law. Since then these 2 monumental programs have provided essential care to families & individuals in Oregon & across our nation. I'll continue to do all I can to strengthen these programs & expand health care access pic.twitter.com/60dvpXKhNT
We must immediately improve conditions for migrants, end family separation, and hold the administration accountable for their violations of law and human rights.

And at our Southern border, thousands of children and teenagers were forcibly separated from their parents or family member by the Trump administration. The physical, psychological, and emotional damage from forced separation may last a lifetime.

Here in Oregon, Morrison is working diligently to care for the young people in their custody, and to find them safe homes. My visit reinforces my commitment to working for a humane immigration and refugee policy that keeps families together.
Congress must be allowed to exercise its oversight role by visiting people—including children—held in federally-funded facilities.

This weekend I toured Morrison Child & Family Services with @SenJeffMerkley, @RepPeterDeFazio, & @repblumenauer. As a mother, it’s heartbreaking to visit detained migrant children and teenagers. https://www.opb.org/news/article/oregon-portland-shelters-unaccompanied-migrants-congress-delegation/ …

Last week I had the chance to welcome @westviewcats' Jennie Cho & her family to DC! She won the #CongressionalArtCompetition for Northwest Oregon. Her piece, "Suffocating," will hang in the U.S. Capitol for a year. pic.twitter.com/GrdDQHsTiN

I'm happy to report that the House passed this important legislation yesterday. I call on my colleagues in the Senate to quickly do the same so we can provide overdue relief to the families & individuals who receive far too many robocalls. #StopBadRobocalls

Oregonians don’t like robocalls! I frequently hear about how unwanted robocalls & telephone scams cause frustration and, in some cases, economic loss. The bipartisan Stopping Bad Robocalls Act will finally put an end to these aggravating calls. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-stands-against-robocalls-abusive-telephone-scams …

Marine debris is entirely preventable, & this bill will accelerate efforts to eliminate marine debris in our ocean & increase investments in infrastructure to reduce the creation & pollution of plastic waste on a global scale #SaveOurSeas #ProtectOurOceans https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-young-unveil-next-step-remove-prevent-marine-pollution …

Every minute, the equivalent of a garbage truck full of plastic is dumped into our oceans. According to the United Nations, that’s more than 8 million tons a year. We still don’t know how long it takes for plastic to completely biodegrade. Estimates range from 450 years to never.

Our ocean is an immense natural resource, but the marine life & habitats it sustains are threatened by the pervasive and destructive plastics and debris that litter its waters and shores. Today I'm introducing #SaveOurSeas 2.0 Act with my House Oceans Caucus Co-Chair @repdonyoung

Today, and every day, I am deeply grateful to the interns who help my offices in DC and Oregon run smoothly. This #NationalInternDay, they will be taking over my Instagram story to show what a day in their life is like! Follow along here:  https://www.instagram.com/repbonamici/  pic.twitter.com/76SX0TvVCM

A new research study found that the #ClimateCrisis has raised global temperatures higher than they have been in the last 2,000 years. The bipartisan SIMPLE Act will streamline the enrollment process for income-driven repayment plans, making it easier for borrowers to access affordable payments and avoid the catastrophic effects of default. Learn more here: https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-mitchell-moulton-fitzpatrick-introduce-bipartisan-bill-help-student …

Too many people are struggling to make payments on burdensome student loans. I'm grateful to @RepPaulMitchell, @teammoulton, & @RepBrianFitz for co-leading my bipartisan SIMPLE Act to help borrowers avoid default.

Although women were largely excluded from #Apollo11, in the 1950s @NASA scientist Dr. Lovelace found that women might be “better suited to space than men.” I support NASA’s work to examine bias in the space program and make room for female astronauts. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/17/science/women-astronauts-nasa.html?smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytimesscience …

And of course, the #HiddenFigures whose mathematical genius made the mission possible: Katherine Johnson, Dr. Christine Darden, Dorothy Vaughan, and Mary Jackson. I'm advocating for swift passage of the Hidden Figures Congressional Gold Medal Act to recognize their achievements.

Poppy Northcutt was the first woman in an operational support role at Mission Control, and she helped get the #Apollo11 astronauts home safely. Read more about how being one of the few women at @NASA inspired her to become a lawyer and an activist: https://time.com/5614162/apollo-11-anniversary-first-woman/ …

Today for the #Apollo50th, I’m remembering some of the women behind the #ManOnTheMoon. Margaret Hamilton was on the team of MIT engineers who developed the software for the #Apollo11 mission that guided them to a safe landing on the Sea of Tranquility. #HiddenFigures pic.twitter.com/qW1YFF9uZ1

President Trump made racist statements about my colleagues and now he’s asking them to apologize? These Congresswomen are US citizens who were duly elected to Congress by their constituents. The President’s offensive rhetoric must not be tolerated.

The Secretary of Labor has a responsibility to advance the best interest of workers. President Trump should nominate someone who will work to strengthen collective bargaining rights, raise stagnant wages, and help workers save for a secure retirement. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-statement-resignation-labor-secretary-acosta …

Mr. Acosta’s actions during his tenure at the Department of Labor continued to demonstrate that he is more interested in protecting the powerful and wealthy than improving the lives of working families across the country.

As a prosecutor, Alexander Acosta denied survivors justice and gave Jeffrey Epstein, who was and is accused of child sex trafficking, a deal that did not serve justice. We have had concerns about the case since his nomination, and his resignation is long overdue.

I stand with the millions of people who rely on the ACA and will continue fighting to make sure the benefits it provides are protected & expanded. @HouseDemocrats have already been working #ForThePeople to lower health costs. We will continue to do so.

The Trump admin is continuing its attack on the Affordable Care Act today by arguing that it should be entirely dismantled, putting the well-being of families and communities at risk. Health care is a right & we must increase – not restrict – access. https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2019/07/09/739653482/the-affordable-care-act-is-back-in-court-5-facts-you-need-to-know …

We know that the #ClimateCrisis is one of the greatest existential threats of our time, & it is up to us to #ActOnClimate. I'm committed to working with my colleagues on @ClimateCrisis and @HouseScience to continue to #DefendScience and take meaningful action protect our planet.

The Administration’s plans to withdraw from the #ParisAgreement, attacks on #CleanCarStandards, efforts to roll back the #CleanPowerPlan, and suppression of science like the #NCA4 have moved us closer to irreparable damage to our planet’s health and our nation’s credibility.

The President can claim that he has made the environment a priority since day one, but we know his real priority has been rolling back bedrock environmental policies. The Admin has knowingly put lives at risk by severely undermining efforts to protect clean air & the environment.
President Trump consistently dismisses and disrespects science, so it is no surprise that some of the statements made at his “environmental” event today lack any scientific basis.
